meanings.definition: To decorate or adorn with something, such as flowers or ribbons.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys readorning her room with colorful posters.
meanings.sent2: During the holidays, people often readorn their houses with lights and ornaments.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to help by readorning the living room with toilet paper.
meanings.sent4: Her smile readorned her face like a bright, cheerful ribbon.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes readorned the plain canvas into a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The act of adding decorative elements to something.
meanings.sent1: The readorning of the cake with icing made it look more festive.
meanings.sent2: She took pride in the readorning of her garden with new plants and sculptures.
meanings.sent3: The readorning of the office with silly string brought laughter to the employees.
meanings.sent4: His readorning of the car with racing stripes gave it a sporty look.
meanings.sent5: The readorning of the classroom with student artwork brightened up the walls.

meanings.definition: The process of enhancing the appearance of something.
meanings.sent1: The readorning of the old building brought new life to the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: She found joy in the readorning of her outfit with sparkling jewelry.
meanings.sent3: The readorning of the cake with extra frosting was a sweet surprise.
meanings.sent4: His readorning of the garden with fairy lights transformed it into a magical space.
meanings.sent5: The readorning of the website with vibrant colors made it more appealing to visitors.
